00042 #define _ccsds_

00049 #include "cfe_mission_cfg.h"

00051 
00052 /* Macro to convert 16 bit word from platform "endianness" to Big Endian */
00053 #ifdef SOFTWARE_BIG_BIT_ORDER
00054   #define CFE_MAKE_BIG16(n) (n)
00055 #else
00056   #define CFE_MAKE_BIG16(n) ( (((n) << 8) & 0xFF00) | (((n) >> 8) & 0x00FF) )
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 
00060 /* CCSDS_TIME_SIZE is specific to the selected CFE_SB time format */
00061 #if (CFE_SB_PACKET_TIME_FORMAT == CFE_SB_TIME_32_16_SUBS)
00062   /* 32 bits seconds + 16 bits subseconds */
00063   #define CCSDS_TIME_SIZE 6
00064 #elif (CFE_SB_PACKET_TIME_FORMAT == CFE_SB_TIME_32_32_SUBS)
00065   /* 32 bits seconds + 32 bits subseconds */
00066   #define CCSDS_TIME_SIZE 8
00067 #elif (CFE_SB_PACKET_TIME_FORMAT == CFE_SB_TIME_32_32_M_20)
00068   /* 32 bits seconds + 20 bits microsecs + 12 bits reserved */
00069   #define CCSDS_TIME_SIZE 8
00070 #else
00071   /* unknown format */
00072   #error unable to define CCSDS_TIME_SIZE!
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 
00076 /*
00077 ** Type Definitions
00078 */
00079 
00080 /**********************************************************************
00081 ** Structure definitions for CCSDS headers.  All items in the structure
00082 ** must be aligned on 16-bit words.  Bitfields must be avoided since
00083 ** some compilers (such as gcc) force them into 32-bit alignment.
00084 **********************************************************************/
00085 
00086 /*----- CCSDS packet primary header. -----*/
00087 
00088 typedef struct {
00089 
00090    uint8   StreamId[2];  /* packet identifier word (stream ID) */
00091       /*  bits  shift   ------------ description ---------------- */
00092       /* 0x07FF    0  : application ID                            */
00093       /* 0x0800   11  : secondary header: 0 = absent, 1 = present */
00094       /* 0x1000   12  : packet type:      0 = TLM, 1 = CMD        */
00095       /* 0xE000   13  : CCSDS version, always set to 0            */
00096 
00097    uint8   Sequence[2];  /* packet sequence word */
00098       /*  bits  shift   ------------ description ---------------- */
00099       /* 0x3FFF    0  : sequence count                            */
00100       /* 0xC000   14  : segmentation flags:  3 = complete packet  */
00101 
00102    uint8  Length[2];     /* packet length word */
00103       /*  bits  shift   ------------ description ---------------- */
00104       /* 0xFFFF    0  : (total packet length) - 7                 */
00105 
00106 } CCSDS_PriHdr_t;
00107 
00108 /*----- CCSDS command secondary header. -----*/
00109 
00110 typedef struct {
00111 
00112    uint16  Command;      /* command secondary header */
00113       /*  bits  shift   ------------ description ---------------- */
00114       /* 0x00FF    0  : checksum, calculated by ground system     */
00115       /* 0x7F00    8  : command function code                     */
00116       /* 0x8000   15  : reserved, set to 0                        */
00117 
00118 } CCSDS_CmdSecHdr_t;
00119 
00120 /*----- CCSDS telemetry secondary header. -----*/
00121 
00122 typedef struct {
00123 
00124    uint8  Time[CCSDS_TIME_SIZE];
00125 
00126 } CCSDS_TlmSecHdr_t;
00127 
00128 /*----- Generic combined command header. -----*/
00129 
00130 typedef struct {
00131    CCSDS_PriHdr_t       PriHdr;
00132    CCSDS_CmdSecHdr_t    SecHdr;
00133 } CCSDS_CmdPkt_t;
00134 
00135 /*----- Generic combined telemetry header. -----*/
00136 
00137 typedef struct {
00138    CCSDS_PriHdr_t       PriHdr;
00139    CCSDS_TlmSecHdr_t    SecHdr;
00140 } CCSDS_TlmPkt_t;
00141

00143 /*
00144 ** Macro Definitions
00145 */
00146 
00147 /**********************************************************************
00148 ** Constant values.
00149 **********************************************************************/
00150 
00151 /* Value of packet type for a telemetry packet. */
00152 #define CCSDS_TLM  0
00153 /* Value of packet type for a command packet. */
00154 #define CCSDS_CMD  1
00155 
00156 /* Value of secondary header flag if secondary header not present. */
00157 #define CCSDS_NO_SEC_HDR   0
00158 /* Value of secondary header flag if secondary header exists. */
00159 #define CCSDS_HAS_SEC_HDR  1
00160 
00161 #define NUM_CCSDS_APIDS        2048
00162 #define NUM_CCSDS_PKT_TYPES    2
00163 
00164 
00165 /**********************************************************************
00166 ** Initial values for CCSDS header fields.
00167 **********************************************************************/
00168 
00169 /* Initial value of the sequence count. */
00170 #define CCSDS_INIT_SEQ      0
00171 /* Initial value of the sequence flags. */
00172 #define CCSDS_INIT_SEQFLG   3
00173 /* Initial value of the command function code. */
00174 #define CCSDS_INIT_FC       0
00175 /* Initial value of the command checksum. */
00176 #define CCSDS_INIT_CHECKSUM 0
00177 
00178 /* Note: the stream ID and length are always explicitly set for a packet,
00179 ** so default values are not required.  */
00180 
00181 
00182 /**********************************************************************
00183 ** Macros for reading and writing bit fields in a 16-bit integer.
00184 ** These are used to implement the read and write macros below.
00185 **********************************************************************/
00186 
00187 /* Read bits specified by 'mask' from 'word' and shift down by 'shift'. */
00188 #define CCSDS_RD_BITS(word,mask,shift) \
00189    (((word) & mask) >> shift)
00190 
00191 /* Shift 'value' up by 'shift' and write to those bits in 'word' that
00192 ** are specified by 'mask'.  Other bits in 'word' are unchanged.   */
00193 #define CCSDS_WR_BITS(word,mask,shift,value) \
00194    ((word) = (uint16)(((word) & ~mask) | (((value) & (mask >> shift)) << shift)))
00195 
00196 
00197 /**********************************************************************
00198 ** Macros for reading and writing the fields in a CCSDS header.  All
00199 ** of the macros are used in a similar way:
00200 **
00201 **   CCSDS_RD_xxx(header)        -- Read field xxx from header.
00202 **   CCSDS_WR_xxx(header,value)  -- Write value to field xxx of header.
00203 **
00204 ** Note that 'header' is a reference to the actual header structure,
00205 ** not to a pointer to the structure.  If using a pointer, one must
00206 ** refer to the structure as *pointer.
00207 **
00208 ** The CCSDS_WR_xxx macros may refer to 'header' more than once; thus
00209 ** the expression for 'header' must NOT contain any side effects.
00210 **********************************************************************/
00211 
00212 /* Read entire stream ID from primary header. */
00213 #define CCSDS_RD_SID(phdr)         (((phdr).StreamId[0] << 8) + ((phdr).StreamId[1]))
00214 /* Write entire stream ID to primary header. */
00215 #define CCSDS_WR_SID(phdr,value)   ( ((phdr).StreamId[0] = (value >> 8)   ) ,\
00216                                      ((phdr).StreamId[1] = (value & 0xff) ) )
00217 
00218 /* Read application ID from primary header. */
00219 #define CCSDS_RD_APID(phdr)         (CCSDS_RD_SID(phdr) & 0x07FF)
00220 /* Write application ID to primary header. */
00221 #define CCSDS_WR_APID(phdr,value)  ((((phdr).StreamId[0] = ((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0xF8) | ((value >> 8) & 0x07))) ,\
00222                                    (((phdr).StreamId[1]  = ((value)) & 0xff)) )
00223 
00224 /* Read secondary header flag from primary header. */
00225 #define CCSDS_RD_SHDR(phdr)         (((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0x08) >> 3)
00226 /* Write secondary header flag to primary header. */
00227 #define CCSDS_WR_SHDR(phdr,value)   ((phdr).StreamId[0] = ((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0xf7) | ((value << 3) & 0x08))
00228 
00229 /* Read packet type (0=TLM,1=CMD) from primary header. */
00230 #define CCSDS_RD_TYPE(phdr)         (((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0x10) >> 4)
00231 /* Write packet type (0=TLM,1=CMD) to primary header. */
00232 #define CCSDS_WR_TYPE(phdr,value)   ((phdr).StreamId[0] = ((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0xEF) | ((value << 4) & 0x10))
00233 
00234 /* Read CCSDS version from primary header. */
00235 #define CCSDS_RD_VERS(phdr)        (((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0xE0) >> 5)
00236 /* Write CCSDS version to primary header. */
00237 #define CCSDS_WR_VERS(phdr,value)  ((phdr).StreamId[0] = ((phdr).StreamId[0] & 0x1F) | ((value << 5) & 0xE0))
00238 
00239 /* Read sequence count from primary header. */
00240 #define CCSDS_RD_SEQ(phdr)         ((((phdr).Sequence[0] & 0x3F) << 8) + ((phdr).Sequence[1]))
00241 /* Write sequence count to primary header. */
00242 #define CCSDS_WR_SEQ(phdr,value)   ((((phdr).Sequence[0] = ((phdr).Sequence[0] & 0xC0) | ((value >> 8) & 0x3f))) ,\
00243                                    (((phdr).Sequence[1]  = ((value)) & 0xff)) )
00244 
00245 /* Read sequence flags from primary header. */
00246 #define CCSDS_RD_SEQFLG(phdr)       (((phdr).Sequence[0] & 0xC0) >> 6)
00247 /* Write sequence flags to primary header. */
00248 #define CCSDS_WR_SEQFLG(phdr,value) ((phdr).Sequence[0] = ((phdr).Sequence[0] & 0x3F) | ((value << 6) & 0xC0) )
00249 
00250 /* Read total packet length from primary header. */
00251 #define CCSDS_RD_LEN(phdr)     ( ( (phdr).Length[0] << 8) + (phdr).Length[1] + 7)
00252 /* Write total packet length to primary header. */
00253 #define CCSDS_WR_LEN(phdr,value)   ((((phdr).Length[0] = ((value) - 7) >> 8)) ,\
00254                                    (((phdr).Length[1] = ((value) - 7) & 0xff)) )
00255 
00256 /* Read function code from command secondary header. */
00257 #define CCSDS_RD_FC(shdr)           CCSDS_RD_BITS((shdr).Command, 0x7F00, 8)
00258 /* Write function code to command secondary header. */
00259 #define CCSDS_WR_FC(shdr,value)     CCSDS_WR_BITS((shdr).Command, 0x7F00, 8, value)
00260 
00261 /* Read checksum from command secondary header. */
00262 #define CCSDS_RD_CHECKSUM(shdr)     CCSDS_RD_BITS((shdr).Command, 0x00FF, 0)
00263 /* Write checksum to command secondary header. */
00264 #define CCSDS_WR_CHECKSUM(shdr,val) CCSDS_WR_BITS((shdr).Command, 0x00FF, 0, val)
00265 
00266 
00267 /**********************************************************************
00268 ** Macros for clearing a CCSDS header to a standard initial state.  All
00269 ** of the macros are used in a similar way:
00270 **   CCSDS_CLR_xxx_HDR(header)      -- Clear header of type xxx.
00271 **********************************************************************/
00272 
00273 /* Clear primary header. */
00274 #define CCSDS_CLR_PRI_HDR(phdr) \
00275   ( (phdr).StreamId[0] = 0,\
00276     (phdr).StreamId[1] = 0,\
00277     (phdr).Sequence[0] = (CCSDS_INIT_SEQFLG << 6),\
00278     (phdr).Sequence[1] = 0,\
00279     (phdr).Length[0] = 0, \
00280     (phdr).Length[1] = 0 )
00281 
00282 /* Clear command secondary header. */
00283 #define CCSDS_CLR_CMDSEC_HDR(shdr) \
00284   ( (shdr).Command = (CCSDS_INIT_CHECKSUM << 0) | (CCSDS_INIT_FC << 8) )
00285 
00286 
00287 #define CCSDS_WR_SEC_HDR_SEC(shdr, value)    shdr.Time[0] = ((value>>24) & 0xFF),  \
00288                                              shdr.Time[1] = ((value>>16) & 0xFF),  \
00289                                              shdr.Time[2] = ((value>>8)  & 0xFF),  \
00290                                              shdr.Time[3] = ((value)     & 0xFF)
00291 
00292 #define CCSDS_RD_SEC_HDR_SEC(shdr)           (((uint32)shdr.Time[0]) << 24) | \
00293                                              (((uint32)shdr.Time[1]) << 16) | \
00294                                              (((uint32)shdr.Time[2]) << 8)  | \
00295                                              ((uint32)shdr.Time[3])
00296 
00297 /* Clear telemetry secondary header. */
00298 #if (CFE_SB_PACKET_TIME_FORMAT == CFE_SB_TIME_32_16_SUBS)
00299   /* 32 bits seconds + 16 bits subseconds */
00300   #define CCSDS_CLR_TLMSEC_HDR(shdr) \
00301   ( (shdr).Time[0] = 0,\
00302     (shdr).Time[1] = 0,\
00303     (shdr).Time[2] = 0,\
00304     (shdr).Time[3] = 0,\
00305     (shdr).Time[4] = 0,\
00306     (shdr).Time[5] = 0 )
00307 
00308 
00309 #define CCSDS_WR_SEC_HDR_SUBSEC(shdr, value) shdr.Time[4] = ((value>>8)  & 0xFF),  \
00310                                              shdr.Time[5] = ((value)     & 0xFF)
00311 
00312 #define CCSDS_RD_SEC_HDR_SUBSEC(shdr)        (((uint32)shdr.Time[4]) << 8)  | \
00313                                              ((uint32)shdr.Time[5])
00314 #elif ((CFE_SB_PACKET_TIME_FORMAT == CFE_SB_TIME_32_32_SUBS) ||\
00315        (CFE_SB_PACKET_TIME_FORMAT == CFE_SB_TIME_32_32_M_20))
00316   /* 32 bits seconds + 32 bits subseconds */
00317   #define CCSDS_CLR_TLMSEC_HDR(shdr) \
00318   ( (shdr).Time[0] = 0,\
00319     (shdr).Time[1] = 0,\
00320     (shdr).Time[2] = 0,\
00321     (shdr).Time[3] = 0,\
00322     (shdr).Time[4] = 0,\
00323     (shdr).Time[5] = 0,\
00324     (shdr).Time[6] = 0,\
00325     (shdr).Time[7] = 0 )
00326 
00327 #define CCSDS_WR_SEC_HDR_SUBSEC(shdr, value) shdr.Time[4] = ((value>>24) & 0xFF),  \
00328                                              shdr.Time[5] = ((value>>16) & 0xFF),  \
00329                                              shdr.Time[6] = ((value>>8)  & 0xFF),  \
00330                                              shdr.Time[7] = ((value)     & 0xFF)
00331 
00332 #define CCSDS_RD_SEC_HDR_SUBSEC(shdr)        (((uint32)shdr.Time[4]) << 24) | \
00333                                              (((uint32)shdr.Time[5]) << 16) | \
00334                                              (((uint32)shdr.Time[6]) << 8)  | \
00335                                              ((uint32)shdr.Time[7])
00336 #endif
00337 
00338 
00339 
00340 /**********************************************************************
00341 ** Macros for extracting fields from a stream ID.  All of the macros
00342 ** are used in a similar way:
00343 **
00344 **   CCSDS_SID_xxx(sid)          -- Extract field xxx from sid.
00345 **********************************************************************/
00346 
00347 /* Extract application ID from stream ID. */
00348 #define CCSDS_SID_APID(sid)   CCSDS_RD_BITS(sid, 0x07FF, 0)
00349 
00350 /* Extract secondary header flag from stream ID. */
00351 #define CCSDS_SID_SHDR(sid)   CCSDS_RD_BITS(sid, 0x0800, 11)
00352 
00353 /* Extract packet type (0=TLM,1=CMD) from stream ID. */
00354 #define CCSDS_SID_TYPE(sid)   CCSDS_RD_BITS(sid, 0x1000, 12)
00355 
00356 /* Extract CCSDS version from stream ID. */
00357 #define CCSDS_SID_VERS(sid)   CCSDS_RD_BITS(sid, 0xE000, 13)
00358 
00359 
00360 /**********************************************************************
00361 ** Macros for frequently used combinations of operations.
00362 **
00363 **   CCSDS_INC_SEQ(phdr)           -- Increment sequence count.
00364 **********************************************************************/
00365 
00366 /* Increment sequence count in primary header by 1. */
00367 #define CCSDS_INC_SEQ(phdr) \
00368    CCSDS_WR_SEQ(phdr, CCSDS_RD_SEQ(phdr)+1)
00369

00373 /*
00374 ** Exported Functions
00375 */
00376 
00377 /******************************************************************************
00378 **  Function:  CCSDS_InitPkt()
00379 **
00380 **  Purpose:
00381 **    Initialize a CCSDS packet.  The primary header is initialized with
00382 **    specified values, and if the Clear flag is set, the rest of the packet
00383 **    is filled with zeros.
00384 **
00385 **  Arguments:
00386 **    PktPtr   : Pointer to primary header of packet.
00387 **    StreamId : Stream ID to use for the packet.
00388 **    Length   : Length of the packet in bytes.
00389 **    Clear    : Indicates whether to clear the entire packet:
00390 **                TRUE = fill sequence count and packet data with zeros
00391 **                       (used after a cold restart)
00392 **                FALSE = leave sequence count and packet data unchanged
00393 **                       (used after a warm restart if data must be preserved)
00394 **
00395 **  Return:
00396 **    (none)
00397 */
00398 
00399 void CCSDS_InitPkt (CCSDS_PriHdr_t  *PktPtr,
00400                     uint16           StreamId,
00401                     uint16           Length,
00402                     boolean          Clear );
00403 
00404 
00405 
00406 /******************************************************************************
00407 **  Function:  CCSDS_LoadCheckSum()
00408 **
00409 **  Purpose:
00410 **    Compute and load a checksum for a CCSDS command packet that has a
00411 **    secondary header.
00412 **
00413 **  Arguments:
00414 **    PktPtr   : Pointer to header of command packet.  The packet must
00415 **               have a secondary header and the length in the primary
00416 **               header must be correct.  The checksum field in the packet
00417 **               will be modified.
00418 **
00419 **  Return:
00420 **    (none)
00421 */
00422 
00423 void CCSDS_LoadCheckSum (CCSDS_CmdPkt_t *PktPtr);
00424 
00425 /******************************************************************************
00426 **  Function:  CCSDS_ValidCheckSum()
00427 **
00428 **  Purpose:
00429 **    Determine whether a checksum in a command packet is valid.
00430 **
00431 **  Arguments:
00432 **    PktPtr   : Pointer to header of command packet.  The packet must
00433 **               have a secondary header and the length in the primary
00434 **               header must be correct.
00435 **
00436 **  Return:
00437 **    TRUE if checksum of packet is valid; FALSE if not.
00438 **    A valid checksum is 0.
00439 */
00440 
00441 boolean CCSDS_ValidCheckSum (CCSDS_CmdPkt_t *PktPtr);
00442 
00443 /******************************************************************************
00444 **  Function:  CCSDS_ComputeCheckSum()
00445 **
00446 **  Purpose:
00447 **    Compute the checksum for a command packet.  The checksum is the XOR of
00448 **    all bytes in the packet; a valid checksum is zero.
00449 **
00450 **  Arguments:
00451 **    PktPtr   : Pointer to header of command packet.  The packet must
00452 **               have a secondary header and the length in the primary
00453 **               header must be correct.
00454 **
00455 **  Return:
00456 **    TRUE if checksum of packet is valid; FALSE if not.
00457 */
00458 
00459 uint8 CCSDS_ComputeCheckSum (CCSDS_CmdPkt_t *PktPtr);
